title: Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation) TSE
text: Please find out what legal form your company has and have this information ready. Here is a list of the available legal forms. We cannot help you here. We (you) also need your 13-digit tax number. You can calculate this using this link. Calculating a 13-digit tax number If you wish, you can enter both the legal form and the 13-digit tax number in the Cowis.Net back office master data. You can find out how and where to do this in this help article. Enter the legal form and the 13-digit tax number
folder: TSE  - Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation)
description:
Please find out what legal form your company has and have this information ready.


Here is a list of the available legal forms.




We cannot help you here.





We (you) also need your 13-digit tax number.

You can calculate this using this link.
Calculating a 13-digit tax number



If you wish, you can enter both the legal form and the 13-digit tax number in the Cowis.Net back office master data.

You can find out how and where to do this in this help article.

Enter the legal form and the 13-digit tax number

title: Enter the legal form and the 13-digit tax number
text: If you have installed the necessary update (at least version 6.4.60 [250303] dated April 8, 2025) of the Cowis.Net Back Office ERP system, you can prepare the registration of your cash registers with the tax office yourself. To do this, go to the Cash Register Closings section. Then go to Settings and select the lowest option: All You are now in the Cowis Settings Enter the letters "tse" (upper or lower case) in the search field. You will see two parameters. The relevant parameter is the one named "KaTseFiskaly." Click on it once, and the parameter will be highlighted in blue. Now click on the three dots in the right-hand area of the window. The parameter set for the TSE settings will open. Now, in the Legal Form drop-down menu, select the appropriate legal form for your company (e.g., a civil law partnership). Next, enter your 13-digit tax number in the corresponding field. A tax number will already be included here; the format was unimportant at the time the TSE was set up, i.e. the format of the tax number that is now entered can vary and look like "123/00125/4565" or "123 00125 4565". Since the tax office report requires a specific format, you can calculate the existing tax number using the link displayed above the field. Clicking this link will open a page in your internet browser: tax number Select your federal state and enter your tax number, which is stored in Cowis. Then click "Calculate." You will receive a 13-digit tax number, which you then enter in the Tax Number field in Cowis.Net. Then click OK to save it in the Cowis database. As always: IF YOU ARE UNSURE, ask support!!
folder: TSE  - Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation)
description:
If you have installed the necessary update (at least version 6.4.60 [250303] dated April 8, 2025) of the Cowis.Net Back Office ERP system, you can prepare the registration of your cash registers with the tax office yourself.


To do this, go to the Cash Register Closings section.




Then go to Settings




and select the lowest option: All


You are now in the Cowis Settings



Enter the letters "tse" (upper or lower case) in the search field.



You will see two parameters. The relevant parameter is the one named "KaTseFiskaly."



Click on it once, and the parameter will be highlighted in blue.



Now click on the three dots in the right-hand area of the window.




The parameter set for the TSE settings will open.



Now, in the Legal Form drop-down menu, select the appropriate legal form for your company (e.g., a civil law partnership).




Next, enter your 13-digit tax number in the corresponding field.

A tax number will already be included here; the format was unimportant at the time the TSE was set up, i.e. the format of the tax number that is now entered can vary and look like "123/00125/4565" or "123 00125 4565".



Since the tax office report requires a specific format, you can calculate the existing tax number using the link displayed above the field.



Clicking this link will open a page in your internet browser:

tax number







Select your federal state and enter your tax number, which is stored in Cowis.


Then click "Calculate."



You will receive a 13-digit tax number, which you then enter in the Tax Number field in Cowis.Net.



Then click OK to save it in the Cowis database.



As always:

IF YOU ARE UNSURE, ask support!!

title: Overall process: Helping customers with reporting to the tax office
text: Translated with DeepL.com (free version) 1. import update on server 2. file->cash registers->create screenshot of this overview 3. enter the correct KaSvKasseNr and KaSvFilialNr for all cash registers in the Cash registers tab (see screenshot of step 2) 4. switch to the COWIS tab and search for and find the parameter KaTseFiskaly, click on it once so that it is highlighted in blue and then click on the 3 dots on the right 5. set PERSON at the top right (has to do with the legal form) 6. click on the blue link above Tax number (13 digits), then have the tax number calculated on the website by selecting the federal state and inserting the tax number->then enter this number in Cowis 4. legal form remains empty only for natural persons 5. for natural persons, fill in salutation, surname and first name, date of birth, identification number (they often do not know the date of birth and identification number, in any case it is not the DE number or the tax number, it must be the identification number, which every person has. If the customer does not have the number, this is not a problem, this is then entered when importing into Elster, you can inform the tax consultant in the e-mail that the date of birth and/or tax identification number must still be entered during import). 5. click on the OK Save in Cowis database button 6. then open the previous window again and this time click on the Create XML for recording 146a button 7. find the files in Explorer under COWIS.NET->Data->Recording 146a 8. send an e-mail with the files to the tax consultant. Here is an example text for the e-mail: Subject: Company name, owner in the case of a natural person, cash register declaration to the tax office in accordance with Section 146a AO Hello Mrs/Mr, Please find attached the XML files for registering the cash registers (in xxx, xx) with the tax office. What is missing in the files (because not available): The date of birth and the identification number of the taxpayer, please enter this when importing into Elstern. If you have any questions, please contact us.
folder: TSE  - Reporting the Cowiskasse to the tax office (preparation)
description:
Translated with DeepL.com (free version)

1. import update on server

2. file->cash registers->create screenshot of this overview

3. enter the correct KaSvKasseNr and KaSvFilialNr for all cash registers in the Cash registers tab (see screenshot of step 2)

4. switch to the COWIS tab and search for and find the parameter KaTseFiskaly, click on it once so that it is highlighted in blue and then click on the 3 dots on the right

5. set PERSON at the top right (has to do with the legal form)

6. click on the blue link above Tax number (13 digits), then have the tax number calculated on the website by selecting the federal state and inserting the tax number->then enter this number in Cowis

4. legal form remains empty only for natural persons

5. for natural persons, fill in salutation, surname and first name, date of birth, identification number (they often do not know the date of birth and identification number, in any case it is not the DE number or the tax number, it must be the identification number, which every person has. If the customer does not have the number, this is not a problem, this is then entered when importing into Elster, you can inform the tax consultant in the e-mail that the date of birth and/or tax identification number must still be entered during import).

5. click on the OK Save in Cowis database button

6. then open the previous window again and this time click on the Create XML for recording 146a button

7. find the files in Explorer under COWIS.NET->Data->Recording 146a

8. send an e-mail with the files to the tax consultant. Here is an example text for the e-mail:


Subject: Company name, owner in the case of a natural person, cash register declaration to the tax office in accordance with Section 146a AO

Hello Mrs/Mr,


Please find attached the XML files for registering the cash registers (in xxx, xx) with the tax office.


What is missing in the files (because not available): The date of birth and the identification number of the taxpayer, please enter this when importing into Elstern.


If you have any questions, please contact us.
